title.narrative: Empowering marginalized people and communities in Fraud prevention and deterrence through Information Communication Technology

description.narrative: The project intends to empower marginalized people and communities in Fraud Prevention and deterrence through Information Communication Technology (Social Accountability) for enhancing service delivery for citizen through Ward Development Committees in Run gwe Ngara Hai Bukombe and Mtwara Districts. One of the critical challenges facing Tanzania today is how the government officials work for the people using resources at their disposal efficiently delivering public goods and services to the people and guaran teeing an equitable distribution of opportunities and national income among citizens.. Now the communities in Tanzania have recognized that public institutions and service providers in Tanzania far too often fail the poor due to the fraud and corruption am ong government officials. Hence this project with the following objectives, to campaign for fraud prevention and deterrence through training education and fraud awareness through ICT, to capacity build of public sectors for improving service delivery at th e grassroots level and to develop digital platform for information sharing about fraud reporting and social mobilization. The expected developmental impact is to ensure improved public service delivery and realization of human rights by enhancing public fi nancial management in the area of revenue management planning and budgeting budget execution budget control and oversight and program monitoring and communication from village and ward level in the selected districts. the main outcome of this project inclu de, Increased awareness of citizens on what fraud is about and their civil right., increased coordination dissemination and administrative information in the public sector leading to improved service delivery as well as increased transparency and accountab ility in the community through establishment of fraud reporting portal. main beneficiaries are Ward Development councilors Village Executive officers School anti corruption club members religious leaders and teachers. Center for Fraud Research and Investig ation (CFRI) is the main implementing organization. CFRI aims at contributing towards the national efforts in combating fraud and financial crimes that's why was selected and the proposal falls under our priority area for support. Website: www.cfri.or.tz
